title: New 'Looney Tunables' Linux bug gives root on major distros
description: A new Linux vulnerability known as 'Looney Tunables' enables local attackers to gain root privileges by exploiting a buffer overflow weakness in the GNU C Library's ld.so dynamic loader. [...]

title: Microsoft now lets you play a game during Windows 11 installs
description: Microsoft has introduced a new twist to the Windows 11 installation and update process, transforming it from a mundane task into an enjoyable experience. [...]

title: Google to bolster phishing and malware delivery defenses in 2024
description: Google will introduce new sender guidelines in February to bolster email security against phishing and malware delivery by mandating bulk senders to authenticate their emails and adhere to stricter spam thresholds [...]

title: Android October security update fixes zero-days exploited in attacks
description: Google has released the October 2023 security updates for Android, addressing 54 unique vulnerabilities, including two known to be actively exploited. [...]

title: ShellTorch flaws expose AI servers to code execution attacks
description: A set of critical vulnerabilities dubbed 'ShellTorch' in the open-source TorchServe AI model-serving tool impact tens of thousands of internet-exposed servers, some of which belong to large organizations. [...]

title: Qualcomm says hackers exploit 3 zero-days in its GPU, DSP drivers
description: Qualcomm is warning of three zero-day vulnerabilities in its GPU and Compute DSP drivers that hackers are actively exploiting in attacks. [...]

title: Microsoft Edge, Teams get fixes for zero-days in open-source libraries
description: Microsoft released emergency security updates for Edge, Teams, and Skype to patch two zero-day vulnerabilities in open-source libraries used by the three products. [...]

title: EvilProxy uses indeed.com open redirect for Microsoft 365 phishing
description: A recently uncovered phishing campaign is targeting Microsoft 365 accounts of key executives in U.S.-based organizations by abusing open redirects from the Indeed employment website for job listings. [...]
